content.summary: This section outlines the procedures for serving legal documents such as process, pleadings, or other papers on non-resident investment advisers, general partners, and managing agents. It specifies how service can be made through appointed agents and details the role of the Commission's Secretary in forwarding documents. It also provides definitions for terms like 'managing agent', 'non-resident', and 'principal office and place of business'.

elements.title: Service on non-resident investment advisers
elements.statement: A person may serve a non-resident investment adviser, non-resident general partner, or non-resident managing agent by furnishing the Commission with one copy of the process, pleadings, or papers, for each named party, and one additional copy for the Commission's records.

elements.title: Forwarding of documents by the Secretary

elements.title: Certification of service by the Secretary
elements.statement: If the Secretary certifies that the Commission was served with process, pleadings, or other papers pursuant to paragraph (a)(1) of this section and forwarded these documents to a named party pursuant to paragraph (a)(2) of this section, this certification constitutes evidence of service upon that party.

elements.title: Definition of Managing Agent
elements.statement: Managing agent means any person, including a trustee, who directs or manages, or who participates in directing or managing, the affairs of any unincorporated organization or association other than a partnership.

elements.title: Definition of Non-resident
elements.statement: Non-resident means an individual who resides in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States; a corporation that is incorporated in or that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States; and a partnership or other unincorporated organization or association that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.

function.name: ElementsDocumentModel

content.summary: This document outlines the procedure for proceedings initiated by the filing of an application or by the Commission's own motion under any section of the Act or related rules. It details the publication of notice, submission of facts by interested persons, issuance of orders, and conditions for holding a hearing. It also defines 'application' for the purposes of this rule.

elements.title: Notice of initiation of proceeding
elements.statement: Notice of the initiation of the proceeding will be published in the Federal Register and will indicate the earliest date upon which an order disposing of the matter may be entered.

terms.reason: The term is a general concept related to communication.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as a key part of the procedure.

terms.reason: The term describes a process or event.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is a central part of the statement.

terms.reason: The term is a specific publication.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as the publication medium.

terms.reason: The term refers to a time-related concept.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the notice details.

terms.reason: The term describes a legal decision or action.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is a key outcome of the proceeding.

The verb phrase describes the action of indicating details.
elements.reason: The statement describes a general procedure that can be applied to specific cases.

elements.title: Submission of facts by interested persons
elements.statement: Any interested person may, within the period of time specified therein, submit to the Commission in writing any facts bearing upon the desirability of a hearing on the matter and may request that a hearing be held, stating his reasons therefor and the nature of his interest in the matter.

terms.reason: The term refers to a general category of individuals involved in the process.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as a participant in the procedure.

terms.reason: The term refers to a time-related concept.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as a constraint for submission.

terms.reason: The term refers to a specific entity, the regulatory body.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as the recipient of submissions.

terms.reason: The term refers to information or data relevant to the hearing.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is a key part of the submission process.

terms.reason: The term describes a condition or consideration for holding a hearing.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is part of the criteria for requesting a hearing.

terms.reason: The term refers to a legal proceeding.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is a central part of the statement.

terms.reason: The term refers to justifications or explanations.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the request for a hearing.

terms.reason: The term describes the type or extent of involvement in the matter.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is part of the information required for a hearing request.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The verb phrase describes the action of submitting facts.
The verb phrase describes the relevance of the facts.
The verb phrase describes the action of requesting a hearing.
The verb phrase describes the action of stating reasons.
elements.reason: The statement outlines a general process for interested persons to submit information and request a hearing.

elements.title: Issuance of order disposing of the matter
elements.statement: An order disposing of the matter will be issued as of course following the expiration of the period of time referred to in paragraph (a) of this section, unless the Commission thereafter orders a hearing on the matter.

terms.reason: The term describes a legal decision or action.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is a key outcome of the proceeding.

terms.reason: The term refers to a time-related concept.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as a constraint for issuing the order.

terms.reason: The term refers to a specific entity, the regulatory body.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as the authority issuing the order.

terms.reason: The term refers to a legal proceeding.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is a central part of the statement.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The verb phrase describes the action of issuing the order.
The verb phrase describes the reference to the period of time.
The verb phrase describes the action of ordering a hearing.
elements.reason: The statement describes a general procedure for issuing an order unless a hearing is ordered.

elements.title: Commission orders a hearing
elements.statement: The Commission will order a hearing on the matter, if it appears that a hearing is necessary or appropriate in the public interest or for the protection of investors, upon the request of any interested person or upon its own motion.

terms.reason: The term refers to a specific entity, the regulatory body.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as the authority ordering the hearing.

terms.reason: The term refers to a legal proceeding.

The verb phrase describes the necessity of a hearing.
The verb phrase describes the appropriateness of a hearing.
The verb phrase describes the condition for ordering a hearing upon request.
The verb phrase describes the condition for ordering a hearing upon motion.
elements.reason: The statement prescribes conditions under which the Commission must order a hearing, making it a rule.

elements.title: Definition of application
elements.statement: For purposes of this rule, an “application” means any application for an order of the Commission under the Act other than an application for registration as an investment adviser.

terms.reason: The term refers to a general category of documents submitted to the Commission.

function.name: ElementsDocumentModel

content.summary: This document defines what constitutes a 'small business' or 'small organization' under the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 for the purposes of the Regulatory Flexibility Act. It specifies criteria related to assets under management, total assets, and control relationships to determine if an investment adviser qualifies as a small entity. It also provides definitions for 'control' and 'total assets' in this context.

elements.title: Definition of small business or small organization
elements.statement: The term small business or small organization for purposes of the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 shall mean an investment adviser that has assets under management of less than $25 million, or such higher amount as the Commission may by rule deem appropriate.

terms.reason: The term is a general category defined by specific criteria.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly defined in the document.

terms.reason: The term is a general category defined by specific criteria.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly defined in the document.

terms.reason: The term is a specific role within the financial industry.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the context of the definition.

terms.reason: The term is a financial metric used to define the size of an investment adviser.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as a criterion.

terms.reason: The term refers to a specific regulatory body.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as the authority setting rules.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The verb phrase 'shall mean' is used to define terms.
The verb 'has' indicates possession of assets.
The phrase 'may deem' indicates potential regulatory action.
elements.reason: The statement provides a general definition applicable to entities meeting certain criteria.

elements.title: Assets under management criterion
elements.statement: An investment adviser has assets under management of less than $25 million, or such higher amount as the Commission may by rule deem appropriate under Section 203A(a)(1)(A) of the Act.

terms.reason: The term is a specific role within the financial industry.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the context of the criterion.

terms.reason: The term is a financial metric used to define the size of an investment adviser.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as a criterion.

terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as the authority setting rules.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The verb 'has' indicates possession of assets.
The phrase 'may deem' indicates potential regulatory action.
elements.reason: The statement specifies a criterion for classification as a small entity.

elements.title: Total assets criterion
elements.statement: An investment adviser did not have total assets of $5 million or more on the last day of the most recent fiscal year.

terms.reason: The term is a specific role within the financial industry.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the context of the criterion.

terms.reason: The term is a financial metric used to define the size of an investment adviser.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as a criterion.

terms.term: Last day of the most recent fiscal year
terms.reason: The term refers to a specific time frame for financial reporting.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as a reference point for the criterion.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The phrase 'did not have' indicates a lack of possession of assets.
elements.reason: The statement specifies a criterion for classification as a small entity.

elements.title: Control relationship criterion
elements.statement: An investment adviser does not control, is not controlled by, and is not under common control with another investment adviser that has assets under management of $25 million or more, or any person (other than a natural person) that had total assets of $5 million or more on the last day of the most recent fiscal year.

terms.reason: The term is a specific role within the financial industry.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the context of the criterion.

terms.reason: The term refers to a power relationship between entities.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as a criterion.

terms.reason: The term is a financial metric used to define the size of an investment adviser.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as a criterion.

terms.reason: The term refers to an entity other than a natural person.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the criterion.

terms.term: Last day of the most recent fiscal year
terms.reason: The term refers to a specific time frame for financial reporting.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as a reference point for the criterion.

verb_symbols: is not under common control with
verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The phrase 'does not control' indicates a lack of power relationship.
The phrase 'is not controlled by' indicates a lack of power relationship.
The phrase 'is not under common control with' indicates a lack of power relationship.
The verb 'has' indicates possession of assets.
The verb 'had' indicates possession of assets in the past.
elements.reason: The statement specifies a criterion for classification as a small entity.

elements.title: Definition of control
elements.statement: Control means the power, directly or indirectly, to direct the management or policies of a person, whether through ownership of securities, by contract, or otherwise.

terms.reason: The term refers to a power relationship between entities.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly defined in the document.

terms.reason: The term refers to the ability to influence or direct.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the definition.

terms.reason: The term refers to the administration of an organization.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the definition.

terms.reason: The term refers to the principles guiding decisions.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the definition.

terms.reason: The term refers to an entity that can be controlled.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the definition.

terms.reason: The term refers to a means of exerting control.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the definition.

terms.reason: The term refers to a legal agreement that can confer control.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the definition.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The verb 'means' is used to define terms.
The phrase 'to direct' indicates the action of control.
elements.reason: The statement provides a general definition applicable to entities meeting certain criteria.

elements.title: Presumption of control in a corporation
elements.statement: A person is presumed to control a corporation if the person directly or indirectly has the right to vote 25 percent or more of a class of the corporation's voting securities.

terms.reason: The term refers to an entity that can exert control.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the presumption.

terms.reason: The term refers to a type of business entity.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as the entity being controlled.

terms.reason: The term refers to a means of exerting control.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the presumption.

terms.reason: The term refers to shares that confer voting rights.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the presumption.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The phrase 'is presumed to control' indicates a legal assumption.
The verb 'has' indicates possession of rights.
elements.reason: The statement specifies a condition under which control is presumed.

elements.title: Presumption of control in a partnership
elements.statement: A person is presumed to control a partnership if the person has the right to receive upon dissolution, or has contributed, 25 percent or more of the capital of the partnership.

terms.reason: The term refers to an entity that can exert control.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the presumption.

terms.reason: The term refers to a type of business entity.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as the entity being controlled.

terms.reason: The term refers to a means of exerting control.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the presumption.

terms.reason: The term refers to financial resources contributed to the partnership.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the presumption.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The phrase 'is presumed to control' indicates a legal assumption.
The verb 'has' indicates possession of rights.
The phrase 'has contributed' indicates a financial contribution.
elements.reason: The statement specifies a condition under which control is presumed.

elements.title: Presumption of control in an LLC
elements.statement: A person is presumed to control a limited liability company (LLC) if the person directly or indirectly has the right to vote 25 percent or more of a class of the interests of the LLC, has the right to receive upon dissolution, or has contributed, 25 percent or more of the capital of the LLC, or is an elected manager of the LLC.

terms.reason: The term refers to an entity that can exert control.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the presumption.

terms.reason: The term refers to a type of business entity.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as the entity being controlled.

terms.reason: The term refers to a means of exerting control.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the presumption.

terms.reason: The term refers to ownership stakes in the LLC.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the presumption.

terms.reason: The term refers to a means of exerting control.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the presumption.

terms.reason: The term refers to financial resources contributed to the LLC.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the presumption.

terms.reason: The term refers to a role within the LLC that can exert control.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the presumption.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The phrase 'is presumed to control' indicates a legal assumption.
The verb 'has' indicates possession of rights.
The phrase 'has contributed' indicates a financial contribution.
The verb 'is' indicates a role or status.
elements.reason: The statement specifies a condition under which control is presumed.

elements.title: Presumption of control in a trust
elements.statement: A person is presumed to control a trust if the person is a trustee or managing agent of the trust.

terms.reason: The term refers to an entity that can exert control.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the presumption.

terms.reason: The term refers to a fiduciary arrangement.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as the entity being controlled.

terms.reason: The term refers to a role within the trust that can exert control.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the presumption.

terms.extracted_reason: The term is mentioned as part of the presumption.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The phrase 'is presumed to control' indicates a legal assumption.
The verb 'is' indicates a role or status.
elements.reason: The statement specifies a condition under which control is presumed.

elements.title: Definition of total assets
elements.statement: Total assets means the total assets as shown on the balance sheet of the investment adviser or other person described above under paragraph (a)(3) of this section, or the balance sheet of the investment adviser or such other person with its subsidiaries consolidated, whichever is larger.

terms.reason: The term refers to a financial metric used to define the size of an entity.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly defined in the document.

terms.reason: The term refers to a financial statement showing assets and liabilities.
